NAS - Neural Access System

Modules¶

The Neural Access System modules are divided into two sections, namely gui and src. The gui section contains another folder with the designs of individual graphical user windows. These designs were created using qt designer. The project also contains a db folder for registered users and a db folder also contains a tmp folder for temporarily storing the files needed for the registration itself. The resources folder is used to store non-self-face stimuli and necessary images for the graphical user interface.

Most modules contain preset values for some parameters, which you can edit in the config.py file. For information about the config.py file, visit the configuration chapter.

Main File¶

nas.main.main()[source]¶

Main program. Opens main_window.

Graphic User Interface¶

The graphical user interface consists of four windows, namely MainWindow, RegistrationWindow , RegStimulationWindow and LoginStimulationWindow.

MainWindow¶

class nas.gui.main_window.MainWindow[source]¶

Class for displaying the main window of the graphical user interface and its manipulation. The user can register or log in.

static check_id(login)[source]¶

Check if user login exists in database.

Parameters

login (string) – User login ID.

Returns

True if login exists in database, false if login is available.

Return type

bool

log_in()[source]¶

Checks whether the user is registered and if so, continues by opening the login_stimulation_window. The user object created during registration is loaded.

register()[source]¶

Checks if the user is registered and if not, continues by opening reg_window. Creates new user with his name, surname and login ID.

set_up_window()[source]¶

Makes other window settings, such as connecting buttons, etc.

RegistrationWindow¶

class nas.gui.registration_window.RegistrationWindow(reg_user)[source]¶

Class for displaying the registration window of the graphical user interface and its manipulation. The main function of this window is to get a photo of the user’s face and turn it into a stimulus. There are two options for capturing a photo, one via the device’s camera and the other via file upload.

Parameters

reg_user (user) – The object of the registering user.

capture_photo()[source]¶

Capture a photo of the user’s face with connected camera. Photo needs to be confirmed by assigned button. The photo is stored in the temporary folder tmp. The path to a temporary folder can be changed in config.py.

choose_file()[source]¶

Displays the selected user face file on CameraLayout. Image needs to be confirmed by assigned button.

connect_camera()[source]¶

Connect chosen camera to camera viewfinder, created in create_camera_widgets(). Photo needs to be captured by assigned button and later confirmed for next processing.

continue_registration()[source]¶

It starts the next stage of registration by opening the reg_stimulation_window.

create_camera_widgets()[source]¶

Creates necessary widgets for camera layout. QLabel for image itself. QLabel for message about this window. QCameraViewfinder for camera.

find_file()[source]¶

Opens the file dialog to select the desired user face file. This file needs to be displayed by assigned button. Supported file types are .jpg, .gif, .jpeg.

process_photo()[source]¶

Creates a stimulus from a user’s face photo. The SelfFace class is used.

set_up_window()[source]¶

Makes other window settings, such as connecting buttons, etc.

show_camera_menu()[source]¶

Displays camera menu and all functional cameras. After choosing specific camera, it needs to be connected and controlled.

show_file_menu()[source]¶

Displays the file menu for searching the user’s photo file.

show_photo()[source]¶

Displays the captured photo in CameraLayout for further confirmation. Confirmation is executed by assigned button.

RegStimulationPresentation¶

class nas.gui.reg_stimulation_window.RegStimuliPresentation(reg_user)[source]¶

Class for displaying the reg. stimulation window of the graphical user interface and its manipulation. The main function of this class is to display individual stimuli to the user and record his EEG signals in his reactions to them.

Parameters

reg_user (user) – The object of the registering user.

end_registration()[source]¶

It terminates the registration, processes the recorded EEG data into a suitable form with DataProcessing, sets the registration parameters of the user object, saves the user object, cleans the temporary folder and enables the subsequent functions of the registered user.

set_up_window()[source]¶

Makes other window settings, such as connecting buttons, etc.

start_recording()[source]¶

Starts recording EEG signals. It is necessary to use a thread for proper functionality.

stimulation()[source]¶

Timer of the stimulation itself

update_start_time()[source]¶

Stimulation start timer. The default is set to 5 seconds, but this time can be changed in the conf.py file.

update_stimuli()[source]¶

Updates the stimulus type. StimuliCreator is used. Each stimulus is timed to 0.3 seconds followed by 1 second of the blank screen.

LoginStimulationPresentation¶

class nas.gui.login_stimulation_window.LoginStimulationPresentation(reg_user)[source]¶

Class for displaying the login stimulation window of the graphical user interface and its manipulation. The main function of this class is to display individual stimuli to the user and record his EEG signals in his reactions to them. These reactions are then classified to indicate whether the user is granted access.

Parameters

reg_user (user) – The object of the registered user.

get_access_data()[source]¶

Classifies access EEG data.

set_up_window()[source]¶

Makes other window settings, such as connecting buttons, etc.

start_recording()[source]¶

Starts recording EEG signals. It is necessary to use a thread for proper functionality.

stimulation()[source]¶

Timer of the stimulation itself

update_start_time()[source]¶

Stimulation start timer. The default is set to 5 seconds, but this time can be changed in the conf.py file.

update_stimuli()[source]¶

Updates the stimulus type. StimuliCreator is used. Each stimulus is timed to 0.3 seconds followed by 1 second of the blank screen.

EndRegistrationWindow¶

class nas.gui.end_registration_window.EndRegistrationWindow(reg_user)[source]¶

Class to display the final window that confirms the registration. The user can perform a test login from this window.

Parameters

reg_user (user) – The object of the registered user.

static clean_tmp()[source]¶

Cleans up the temporary files folder.

get_reaction_plot()[source]¶

Creates a graph of responses to self-face and non-self-face stimuli. This graph is stored at TMP_END_FIGURE.

set_end_figure()[source]¶

Draw a graph of the reaction in the window.

set_up_window()[source]¶

Makes other window settings, such as connecting buttons, etc.

testing_log_in()[source]¶

Performs a test login.

EndLoginWindow¶

class nas.gui.end_login_window.EndLoginWindow(reg_user, system_access)[source]¶

Class to display the success of a user login.

Parameters

  • reg_user (user) – The object of the registered user.

  • system_access (bool) – User access rights.

set_up_window()[source]¶

Makes other window settings, such as connecting buttons, etc.

Source¶

Source files consist of user, self_face, stimuli_creator, eeg_recorder , data_processing and classifier.

User¶

class nas.src.user.User(name, surname, login_id)[source]¶

Class for creating a user object and storing it.

Parameters

  • name (string) – User name.

  • surname (string) – User surname.

  • login_id (string) – User login ID.

get_id()[source]¶

User id getter.

Returns

User id.

Return type

string

User name getter.

Returns

User name.

Return type

string

get_reg_data()[source]¶

Registration data getter.

Returns

user_stimuli_windows, window_types

Return type

list, list

get_surname()[source]¶

User surname getter.

Returns

User surname.

Return type

string

get_user_stimulus()[source]¶

User’s stimulus getter.

Returns

Picture of a user’s face.

Return type

base64 string

save_user()[source]¶

Saves the user object using pickle library. The path where the object is saved can be changed in config.py.

set_reg_data(user_stimuli_windows, window_types)[source]¶

Registration data setter. Length of user_stimuli_windows and window_types must be the same.

Parameters

  • user_stimuli_windows (list) – User responses to stimuli divided into time windows.

  • window_types (list) – Types of individual time windows. 1 for self-face and 0 for non-self-face.

set_user_stimulus(stimulus)[source]¶

User’s stimulus setter.

Parameters

stimulus (base64 string) – Picture of a user’s face.

SelfFace¶

class nas.src.self_face.SelfFace(path)[source]¶

A class that creates a stimulus from a photo of a user’s face. Stimulus is an image encoded in base64 string.

Parameters

path (string) – Path to the desired photo. This path can be changed in config.py.

create()[source]¶

It will try to crop the user’s face. Sets the success of the operation. Sets the success of the operation and encodes this result using base64. The processed photo is temporarily saved in tmp_image_path. This path can be changed in config.py.

get_face_b64()[source]¶

Stimulus getter.

Returns

Encoded stimulus.

Return type

base64 string

get_status()[source]¶

Create status getter. This status is used to report an error to the user.

Returns

Status of operation. True if successful otherwise False.

Return type

bool

StimuliCreator¶

class nas.src.stimuli_creator.StimuliCreator(user_face)[source]¶

Class for random display of stimuli to the user. These stimuli consist of self-face and non-self-face images.

Parameters

user_face (base64 string) – User stimulus.

get_stimuli_types()[source]¶

Return types of generated stimuli types. This list is used for classification.

Returns

List of generated stimuli types.

Return type

list

learning_stimuli()[source]¶

Stimulation for the registration process. This stimulation is not randomized. Every fifth stimulus is self-face stimulus.

Returns

set_non_self_face_stimulus() or set_self_face_stimulus()

Return type

QPixmap

randomized_stimuli()[source]¶

Stimulation for the log in process. This stimulation is randomized.

Returns

set_non_self_face_stimulus() or set_self_face_stimulus()

Return type

QPixmap

static set_non_self_face_stimulus()[source]¶

Get non-self-face stimulus.

Returns

Specific non-self-face stimulus.

Return type

QPixmap

set_self_face_stimulus()[source]¶

Get self-face stimulus.

Returns

Self-face stimulus.

Return type

QPixmap

DataProcessing¶

class nas.src.data_processing.DataProcessing(data, timestamps, stimuli_timestamps, stimuli_num)[source]¶

A class that processes and filters EEG data.

Parameters

  • data (numpy.array) – EEG data.

  • timestamps (numpy.array) – EEG data timestamps.

  • stimuli_timestamps (numpy.array) – Timestamps of stimulation.

  • stimuli_num (int) – Number of stimules.

create_time_windows()[source]¶

Method to get stimuli time windows.

Returns

List of time windows.

Return type

list

filter_data()[source]¶

Filters data from unwanted artifacts and filters noise.

Classifier¶

class nas.src.classifier.Classifier(login_data, reg_data, reg_data_types, login_data_types)[source]¶

A class that classifies login EEG data.

Parameters

  • login_data (list) – Login EEG data. List of login data time windows.

  • reg_data (list) – Registration EEG data. List of registration data time windows.

  • reg_data_types (list) – Registration data time windows types.

classify(classification_method)[source]¶

Classify login EEG data.

Parameters

classification_method (string) – Method of classification.

Returns

Result of classification.

Return type

list

reduce_dimension_lda()[source]¶

Reduction of the dimension of EEG data for the correct functioning of the classification method.
